metadata.Title: CVE-2017-2906 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description: An exploitable integer overflow exists in the animation playingfunctionality of the Blender open-source 3d creation suite version 2.78c. Aspecially created '.avi' file can cause an integer overflow resulting in abuffer overflow which can allow for code execution under the context of theapplication. An attacker can convince a user to use the file as an asset inorder to trigger this vulnerability.

criterions.comment: blender: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
